comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Comments from an earlier version that was replaced 1. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nellibell49] Thank you for this one. Splendid. 2. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks State Records NSW - beachcombing time! 3. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Evocative presentation. Brilliant. Salt Water by Luka Bloom (re swimming at Coogee) 4. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/53922404@N05] Entrancing. But do tell please how to make a 'moving phorograph' of one's own. I've used Microsoft Photo Story with multiple photos and CC music successfully in the past to encourage educators to use CC resources but am intrigued to know how this and the Powerhouse Bandstand exploration actually were prepared - what program did you use for this presentation and how do you get the resolution on the close-ups so nice? Thanks, Jenny 5. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/48420463@N05] In this instance we were greatly helped by having a glass plate negative to work with. We are hoping to publish a step by step blog post about the process in the New Year! 6. [http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum_photography] Wow, this is wonderful!
